body:
Unlike https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/29550, it seems you have a minimal repro. That is great :) However, I can't repro this with your steps, using 8ec562fe522a. Can you bisect?

Your backtrace points to: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/8ec562fe522a35e454634dbc96c8832f8bb2a1fb/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua#L446-L447

Maybe there's a bug in `Range.intersection()` ...

rename.from: Treesitter invalid 'end_col' error in markdown files

body:
I haven't got time to bisect now, but using `g:_ts_force_sync_parsing` fixes the issue, which implies that there's a problem with async parsing but not with synchronous parsing.

More specifically the following will not reproduce the error:

```sh
nvim --clean err-repro.md +'let g:_ts_force_sync_parsing=1' +'lua vim.treesitter.start()' +66
```

The error is not specific to markdown. It was also reported in, and is probably caused by https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/35536#issuecomment-3286556186
Could this be related to the removed `cmp_lt` checks from the old `add_mark`? @bfredl
I'm don't mind working on this, I think the reason this was broken by #35536 was just because it reverted #32619

For reference, also [seeing this in CI](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/actions/runs/17870704990/job/50823570989) : 

```
ERR 2025-09-19T22:08:56.547 T3389.17395.0 decor_provider_error:29: Error in decoration provider "range" (ns=nvim.treesitter.highlighter):
Lua: ...neovim/neovim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:446: Invalid 'col': out of range
stack traceback:
	[C]: in function 'nvim_buf_set_extmark'
	...neovim/neovim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:446: in function 'fn'
	...neovim/neovim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:247: in function 'for_each_highlight_state'
	...neovim/neovim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:365: in function <...neovim/neovim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:338>
```

Can async parsing apply highlights from a tree that's (slightly) out-of-date but not position edited? then we either need an extra end_col check or make `nvim_buf_set_extmark()` slightly more forgiving for ephemeral marks?

> UPD:
> While this works, it feels a bit hacky.

would be fine as a workaround if we want to get rid of the explicit errors since https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/35536 , but the root cause would be still good to fix "eventually".

issue.title: fix(highlight): allow ephemeral extmarks past final newline

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

issue.body:
Fixes #35814

Note: this is a temporary workaround; proper concurrency-safe handling of highlighting should be investigated.

body:
Issue still persists even after the fix.
I am using NVIM v0.12.0-dev-1304+g42aae632be.

#### Steps to reproduce
1. Download the attached markdown file [foo.md](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22568854/foo.md).  
2. `nvim --clean foo.md +'lua vim.treesitter.start()'`
3. `dd`
